page.title: 17The River Trent Collingham
page.content: One of the most dangerous rivers in Britain because of its treacherous currents,it also contains some of the best{fishing }for miles around.The river was once very badly polluted, but after a clean up campaign,even salmon are sometimes seen.The fishermen and the herons are disturbed only by the occasional pleasure craft, for the commercial traffic is no more. In the last century,prior to the coming of the railways,heavy barges were much in evidence."The Jolly Bargeman",once a busy riverside pub and staging point for horses is now a childrens holiday home. {Cromwell Lock }is the tidal limit of the River Trent,being manned 24 hours daily.Nearby is a memorial stone to 10 soldiers of the 131st Independent Parachute Regiment who were drowned in September 1975 in the notorious{oven.
